        Returns:

      • getDistinctTimeZones

        public static Collection<org.joda.time.DateTimeZone> getDistinctTimeZones()
        Returns a set of timezones that are distinct form each other in the kind of offsets they have from UTC. Note: This method returns timezones having the same offsets but are different in that they have fixed or non-fixed offsets. However, it's possible that two timezones with non-fixed offsets have different transitions, only one of such timezones will be returned here.

      • assertContains

        public static void assertContains(String haystack,
                  Object needle)

      • assertEqualsWithNiceMessage

        public static void assertEqualsWithNiceMessage(Object actual,
                               Object expected)
        Same as TestNG's Assert.assertEquals(Object, Object) except the message text is guaranteed to use the Object.toString() of the objects. Useful for short maps and lists where seeing all the elements is more useful than just the one differing element or size difference.
        Parameters:
        actual -
        expected -

      • assertEqualsWithNiceMessage

        public static void assertEqualsWithNiceMessage(Object actual,
                               Object expected,
                               String message)
        Same as TestNG's Assert.assertEquals(Object, Object) except the message text is guaranteed to use the Object.toString() of the objects. Useful for short maps and lists where seeing all the elements is more useful than just the one differing element or size difference.
        Parameters:
        actual - actual value
        expected - expected value
        message - custom message to prepend to default message
